title: Slide Puzzle Challenge
summary: Here is my admission assignment for the HKU college
description:
Game rules 
 Try to solve the sliding puzzles as soon as possible before the timeline ends. For each puzzle you get some extra time, but the level increases during the course of the game. Try to get the highest possible score and beat your own high score! Special mechanic!The interesting thing about this game is the fact that you get a time pressure when solving these sliding puzzles. This ensures that the game first starts with easy puzzles to solve so that the player does not get overwhelmed. Solving this combination of time pressure and a soothing sliding puzzle creates an interesting twist!

title: Blasterfest
summary: Unity project made for my study in Amsterdam (Media College Amsterdam)
description: For this school project, we as developpers were assigned to create a game and make our own assignments. We were free to hire other developers and artists for our project. We had our priorities on making a working prototype and good communication within our team.

title: Blocks
summary: Unity project made for my study in Amsterdam (Media College Amsterdam)
description:
In the beginning of our second year at Media College Amsterdam, we were assigned to make a '2D endless runner' game with a team of mainly three developers.

It is made in a 3D Unity and we asked permission from the client to use it if we were able to look like 2D.

I have learned many things in this project and was my introduction to Unity.

title: Correct the field
description:
This personal project started when I wanted to learn more about 2D arrays and grid systems. So I decided to make a puzzle game based on the mini game: 'Puzzle Panic'.

I realized with this project that creating the core gameplay is just the half work, because I spent more time on making the UI and getting the little things right.

title: Crystales
description:
A game jam we made during 'Mediabites 2016' where I volunteered with 7 other developers and artists to make a game with the theme 'connecting'.

In 24 hours we had to come up with a concept and make a prototype/game based around the concept.

The 24 hours were not as hard as I thought it would be, but in the last couple of hours we struggled to keep awake. Luckilly we finished our prototype: Crystales!.

It was a unique experience for me and my team and personally want to do it again next year!

title: Flocking
summary: Unity and HTM5 project made fun and to study the flocking algorithm
description:
This project was made to understand the flocking algorithm and group behaviour.

I devided this project in two: a javascript project to understand the algorithm and a Unity project to implement it in 3D with animals (fish to be precise).

The flocking algorithm is aplied to each agent in a group. Each agent follows the flocking algorithm based on 3 rules:

  • Cohesion (agent wants to be part of the group based on de the average position of their neighbours.)
  • Seperation (agent doesn't want to get too close so takes the distance of each neigbour and adds it up to its vector and the namde negative.)
  • Allignment (agent wants to get the same direction as its neighbours, so it takes the average direction vector of its neighbours.)

    • The agent adds all these three vectors to one direction and then it has its direction it wants to go to be in the group.

    My role

    ---Javascript project---


  • Made javascript art
  • Implemented the flocking algorithm
  • CSS programmed (based on O'rbit's CSS.)

    • ---Unity project---


  • Implemented the flocking algorithm
  • Level design
  • Camera/player movement
  • Different fish behaviour
    • Fish model source
    Rock model source

    Game features:

    ---Javascript project---


  • Adjustable variables tweaking
  • Attractors/magnets the agents want to follow (mouse)
  • Different spawning mechanics

    • ---Unity project---


  • Camera/player movement
  • Different schools of fish
  • Different fish behaviour

title: Orbit
summary: HTML5 project to explore gravititational pulling and vectors.
description:
When my class were learning about programming planet orbits and forces in Javascript

I was impressed by the movements of the objects rotating around the center that I was eager to og on with mutliple objects.

I experimented with various spawning algorithms and forces and I saw interesting formations as you can see in the screen recordings here. I putted the variables in a consolo left above the screen to open.

The resuls: an amazing visual light show for you to experiment yourself with!

My role

  • Game programmed in Javscript
  • Made the orb art.
  • CSS programmed

    • Game features:

  • Menu to tweak variabls
  • Good visual representation
  • Endless posiblities

title: Smashers
description:
Description

In my 1st year, I wanted to make a platform fighting game. I made it in Actionscript 3.

I am proud of the AI enemy I created in less than a day, and the different area's you can fight in.

My role

  • Made art
  • Programmed the game.

    • Game features:

  • Fighting mechanics
  • 2 players or AI

title: water run
summary: Unity project made for my study in Amsterdam (Media College Amsterdam)
description:
A 8 week project for school where we made a game for mobile and set in for free in the Google play store.

Our subject for the game was mythe, so we chose the rainbow serpent (a fable animal) to be the theme of our game.

This is my first mobile game I've worked so far and with the biggest team so far (10 people). And I am proud of the result!s

My role

  • Programming the 'sky form' and transition into it.
  • Proggramming the healthbar.
  • Programming the enemies.
  • Designing some of the level parts.

    • Game features:

  • Endless runner
  • Online highscore
  • Static and moving obstacles
  • Increasing difficulty
  • Randomanized chunks
  • Tutorial chunks for beginners
  • Snake movement
  • Particles for game feel

title: the Heart
summary: HTML5 project based on a mathologer video.
description:
This project demonstrates the calculations for a refelction in a cup buy a facor of n. You see n = 2 in nature like lightbeams on a cofee cup or rolling a circle with half the size around the other circle.

Inspiration came from the youtube video from Matheloger:Click here

Here is the article about light intervals: Click here

You can see many patterns unfolding like parts of the mandelbrot, spirals and more.

I haven't found many articles or information about this, so I can't recall a name for this one.So, I call it the heart of mathematics.

My role

  • Programmed the application.
  • CSS made

    • Game features:

  • Random color lerping
  • Interctivity about the multiplication factor and how many points the circle has.
  • Animation of in/decreasing multiplication factors
